gameDescription: Operation Pollination brings players into a future where survival of bees and the global ecosystem is threatened. Players command advanced airships, under the banner of Apis Aviators (Red Team) and the Bombus Navigators (Blue Team), on a mission to restore bee populations and habitats affected by natural disasters and human activities.

blueTeam.name: Bombus Navigators
blueTeam.description: Known for ecological strategy and technology integration.

redTeam.name: Apis Aviators
redTeam.description: Pioneers of bee colony relocation and preservation.

turns.scenario: Post-Hurricane Recovery: Hurricane devastation has left bee habitats ravaged. Will you restore the original habitats or establish new ones in safer zones?

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones, ensuring their survival post-disaster.

AA.narrative: Both teams committed to restoring the original habitats. Living conditions improved, and the bee populations are thriving again.

AB.narrative: The Apis Aviators prioritized habitat restoration while the Bombus Navigators moved colonies to safer zones. It was a coordinated balance of past and future.

BA.narrative: The Bombus Navigators focused on native flower restoration and the Apis Aviators moved colonies. The environment found equilibrium through divergent strategies.

BB.narrative: Both teams established new colonies in safe zones. The bees adapted well, and the colonies are flourishing in their new homes.

turns.scenario: Wildfire Restoration: Wildfires have decimated vast bee habitats. How will your team respond?

options.A: Seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation to encourage ecological recovery.
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions to support displaced populations.

AA.narrative: Both teams planted bee-friendly vegetation in fire-affected zones. Time will tell, but early signs of plant growth are promising for ecosystem recovery.

AB.narrative: The Apis Aviators seeded fire-ravaged areas while the Bombus Navigators built artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions. A two-pronged approach maximized ecological support.

BA.narrative: The Bombus Navigators seeded fire-affected zones while the Apis Aviators built artificial hives. The separated spaces provided excellent opportunities for bee population growth.

BB.narrative: Both teams focused on creating artificial habitats outside the wildfire zones. These safe havens provide temporary respite as the natural habitat slowly rejuvenates.

turns.scenario: Sustainable Expansion: As the world continues to change, sustainable expansion is necessary. How can you support that?

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology for optimal habitat conditions.
options.B: Launch educational campaigns to promote bee conservation and awareness.

AA.narrative: Both teams concentrated on developing advanced tech bee sanctuaries. The results? Healthy, vibrant bee communities.

AB.narrative: While Apis Aviators were busy creating tech-based sanctuaries, the Bombus Navigators were inspiring the public with their educational campaign. A perfect blend of technological and societal approaches.

BA.narrative: The Bombus Navigators developed their advanced sanctuaries, while the Apis Aviators took to the streets and the web to increase awareness about bee conservation. True synergy of action.

BB.narrative: Both teams decided to empower society, launching massive education campaigns. Public response? Big thumbs up. The world is now buzzz-ing with bee awareness.
